title: Life as a migrant ‘host’ in the red-light district of Chiang Mai, Thailand
content: An interview with a Shan man sex worker in Thailand Originally published on Global Voices Image from Prachatai, content partner of Global Voices This article, written by Wanna Taemthong, was published by Prachatai, an independent news site in Thailand. An edited version has been republished by Global Voices under a content partnership agreement. For migrants, particularly those from Myanmar, Thailand can be a land of opportunity. title: Researchers in Africa are using AI to fill the global health care gap
content: From rural Kenya to northern Nigeria, artificial intelligence is turning smartphones into medical laboratories Originally published on Global Voices A child being given an injection . Image by Kwameghana via Wikimedia Commons ( CC BY-SA 4.0 Deed ). By Chukwudi Anthony Okolue In 2024, a 28-year-old maize farmer in Siaya County , western Kenya, walked into a small public clinic complaining of a fever. Ten years ago, he would have waited days — sometimes weeks — for a malaria, typhoid, or dengue di...

title: Why Japan’s upcoming lower house election feels like a race to the bottom
content: While the elections mark a policy shift, many see that as just another spectacle Originally published on Global Voices Screenshot from a video about upcoming Japanese lower house snap elections on the YouTube channel にっこりまっこり . The viral video is edited according to the latest opening theme from the popular anime Jujutsu Kaisen. While the rise of social media and the resulting surge of populism are global trends, in Japan, this phenomenon takes on a unique and troubling form, as populist politic...
